input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ATOS FRANCE. Summary: Destine Platform - Advanced Application & Services Onboarding - Round 2. Description: Destination Earth (DestinE) is a flagship initiative coordinated by the European Commission (EC) and jointly implemented by three entrusted entities: ESA, ECMWF, and EUMETSAT. DestinE-s objective is to develop a highly accurate digital model of the Earth (a digital twin of the Earth) to model, monitor and simulate natural phenomena, hazards, and the related human activities. These groundbreaking features assist users in designing accurate and actionable adaptation strategies and mitigation measures. DestinE unlocks the potential of digital modelling of the Earth system at a level that represents a real breakthrough in terms of accuracy, local detail, access-to-information speed and interactivity. By pushing the limits of computing and climate sciences, DestinE is an essential pillar of the EC-s efforts towards the Green Deal and Digital Strategy. ESA is responsible for operating the DestinE Platform providing a large number of users with access to observations, simulations and models, evidence-based policy and decision-making tools, applications and services. The current Open Competition (OC) is managed by Atos, on behalf of ESA, in order to promote the availability and attractiveness of an ecosystem of DestinE Advanced Applications and Services (AAS) supporting the exploitation of the Digital Twins. Primary objective of this OC is to select service providers as subcontractors to Atos, and subsequently onboard and operate as part of the DestinE platform AAS leveraging cutti.... Published Date: 2025-06-02. Closing Date: 2025-07-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ATOS FRANCE. Summary: Destine Service Platform Advanced Application Services. Description: Destination Earth is a flagship initiative of the European Commission towards the Green Deal and Digital Strategy. DestinE is coordinated by the European Commission and jointly implemented by three entrusted entities: ESA, ECMWF, and EUMETSAT. ESA is responsible for the development of the DestinE Core Service Platform for providing a large number of users with access to observations, simulations and models, evidence-based policy and decision-making tools, applications and services. On behalf of ESA, Atos will manage this tender to allow an Open Competition (OC) for Advanced Application and Services (AAS) to be selected to operate as part of the DestinE Platform framework. The goal of this OC is to onboard on DestinE Platform a wide variety of AAS across different applicable fields, functionalities, and complexities. Mature Applications and Services that are evaluated very close to Technology Readiness Level (TRL) 8 with expectations of achieving this level during the onboarding phase, will be eligible for tendering in this OC. Funding of this OC is planned to cover onboarding and initial operations (for a defined period of time) on the DestinE platform. It will be the object of a contract between Atos and the service provider. By actively contributing to the DestinE ecosystem with innovative solutions and expertise, the Contractor will not only tap into new markets and attract fresh users but also enhance their visibility. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COUNCIL OF EUROPE. Summary: Tender Call for the Provision of Market Research Services to Assess Perceptions on Child Sexual Abuse in Croatia. Description: The Council of Europe is currently implementing the project “Implementing the Barnahus Model in Croatia”. This Project is implemented by the Council of Europe's Children's Rights Division in close co-operation with the Croatian Ministry of Justice, Public Administration and Digital Transformation and the European Commission-s Directorate General for Structural Reform Support (EC/DG REFORM) during the period 1 September 2023 to 28 February 2026. The general objective of the project is to support Croatia in its efforts to design, develop and implement reforms in the field of child-friendly justice and protection of children-s rights. More specifically, the project aims to improve the access and quality of the justice system for child victims and witnesses of violence in Croatia, to ensure that undue delays in the treatment of such cases is diminished, and that all children who are victims and witnesses of sexual violence benefit from a child-friendly access to justice. This will be achieved through the implementation of the Barnahus Model which is the leading European model for a child-friendly multidisciplinary and interagency response to child sexual exploitation and abuse. In that context, it is looking for Providers for the provision of market research services to assess general understanding of child sexual abuse in Croatia. <br> Doc Title: Tender call for the provision of market research services to assess perceptions on child sexual abuse in Croatia <br> Contract Type: ser.... Published Date: 2024-10-22. Closing Date: 2024-11-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The general objective of the project is to support Croatia in its efforts to design, develop and implement reforms in the field of child-friendly justice and protection of children-s rights. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RESEAU DES ACHETEURS HOSPITALIERS IDF. Summary: Open Market Consultation of Procure4health for the Future Pre-Commercial Procurement of R&D Services Concerning On-Site Treatment of Hospital Wastewater. Description: This is an announcement of an Open Market Consultation regarding a potential future pre-commercial procurement (PCP) of R&D services concerning on-site treatment of hospital wastewater. The future PCP will be composed of three phases: Phase 1. Solution design: Phase 1 of the PCP will deal with the design of the solutions and verification of their technical and economic feasibility based on functional requirements. It will be implemented according to the tender documents in compliance with the procurement principles and the PCP methodology. Several technology providers will be selected for this phase. Phase 2. Prototype implementation: Phase 2 of the PCP concerns the development of the first prototypes of the solutions and testing at the procurers- premises under controlled conditions. Several technology providers will be selected for this phase. Phase 3. Validation and demonstration of the solutions: Phase 3 of the PCP will deal with testing and validation of the selected solutions in operational environments. It will take place in several Member States. A minimum of 2 operators per challenge will be selected for this phase. The selected operators will retain ownership of the Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs) that they will generate during the PCP and will be able to use them to exploit the full market potential of the developed solutions. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COUNCIL OF EUROPE. Summary: Educative Solution. Description: The Procurement Guide is intended for all Council of Europe staff wishing to make a purchase. It documents the procedures, the roles of the various parties involved and the stages in the Procurement process. It includes both the normative and performance aspects of the Procurement process, examples and best practices. Its main objective is to enable everyone to find an answer to their Procurement questions, particularly for people new to the Council. As our legislation is unique, it is essential to understand it quickly and effectively. The current format (a 130-page Word document) makes it difficult to read the information clearly and concisely. It is also complicated for a novice to find the right terminology to obtain a complete answer, or to navigate between all the chapters referring to the term sought. The Procurement guide can be sent to interested service providers subject to a confidentiality agreement. <br> Doc Title: Educative solution <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2024-03-26. Closing Date: 2024-04-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Educative Solution

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GIP RESAH IDF. Summary: Open Market Consultation of Procure4health for the Future Precommercial Procurement of R&D Services Concerning Sustainable Personal Protection against Pathogens. Description: Title: Open Market Consultation of PROCURE4HEALTH for the future PreCommercial Procurement of R&D services concerning sustainable personal protection against pathogens Description: This Prior Information Notice announces the Open Market Consultation conducted by the PROCURE4HEALTH project and provides information about a potential future PreCommercial Procurement (PCP) of R&D services concerning sustainable personal protection against pathogens. PROCURE4HEALTH aims to challenge the market to develop innovation solutions that can operate as an alternative to singleuse facemasks, providing the same level of protection as disposable masks while significantly reducing the environmental footprint. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. The PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. The future PCP will be composed of three phases: Pha.... Published Date: 2024-03-11. Closing Date: 2025-03-11. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COUNCIL OF EUROPE. Summary: Consultancy in the Area of Execution of the Ecthr Judgements. Description: The Project-s activities include developing a methodology and setting up a mechanism based on which a study (“Multi-Country Study”) will be carried out focusing on the functional relevance of the existing mechanisms for execution of the ECtHR judgments in the member states in the light of the CM Recommendation (2008)2 and identifying good practices and effective national execution mechanisms. It is envisaged that the Multi-Country Study will be based on local studies carried out with the support of academia and experts already studying the subject of implementation of the ECHR in the member states. It is envisaged that the Project will develop a common methodology in order to support the collection and analysis of comparable data for carrying out the Multi-Country Study. In parallel, the Project will also establish formats for experience exchange and mutual support between those coordinating authorities. Beyond the organisation of seminars and other events, the Project targets the creation of the “Execution Coordinators Network”, a collective responsibility network aimed at enabling member states to support each other in the process of executing judgments of the European Court of Human Rights. A preliminary study (“Network Development Study”) will be carried out to identify a recommended format and structure for the network. Closing Date: 2024-03-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SET AXLR. Summary: Studies for the Myomu Project. Description: In this context, SATT AxLR is looking for companies capable of carrying out the following activities, separated into 3 lots: Lot n1: The company will carry out medicinal chemistry to synthesize at least 50 drug-type compounds (intermediates excluded) around the scaffolding of Carnosol (formula1). The company's ability to supply more compounds would be a plus. The objective is to generate new IP thanks to patentable molecules with optimized activity compared to Carnosol. Lot n2: The company will carry out ADME-Tox in-vitro studies on the 2 to 4 best selected compounds.born during batch n1. The company's ability to propose and argue additional tests will be a plus. Batch n3: The company will synthesize 5 to 10 g of the 2 compounds selected in batch n1 with quality control criteria to be determined.<br> Doc Title: Research and development services and related consultancy services<br> Contract Type: Services. Tender Value: 170000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2023-08-05. Closing Date: 2023-09-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Studies for the Myomu Project

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CS GROUP - FRANCE _ SPACE BUSINESS UNIT. Summary: Csc Data Processors - Re-Engineering of Level-1 and Level-2 Sentinel-3 Sral and Mwr Data Processors. Description: The CSC Data Processors Re-engineering Service aims at the implementation of a new Earth Observation Processor Framework (EOPF) and the re-engineering of the data processors currently used to operationally generate the Copernicus Sentinel-1/2/3(land) Level-0, Level-1, Level-2 data with the aim to harmonise and modernise the operational processing framework, to benefit from the capabilities of cloud-based environments such as the elasticity of computing resources and to efficiently support both the systematic production operations as well as the needs of a more flexible on-demand production context.CS GROUP has been selected by ESA as Prime Contractor for the Sentinels Data Processors Re-engineering Service. As part of this Service, CS GROUP will procure the implementation of the Sentinels processors re-engineering via open competitive tenders according to the ESA Best Practices procedure. This last open competitive tender covers the re-engineering of S3 SRAL and MWR processors. <br> Doc Title: Research and development services and related consultancy services <br> Contract Type: Services. Published Date: 2023-07-05. Closing Date: 2024-07-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: CS GROUP - FRANCE _ SPACE BUSINESS UNIT
output.Summary: Csc Data Processors - Re-Engineering of Level-1 and Level-2 Sentinel-3 Sral and Mwr Data Processors

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CS GROUP - FRANCE _ SPACE BUSINESS UNIT. Summary: Csc Data Processors - Re-Engineering of Level-1 and Level-2 Sentinel-1 Data Processors. Description: The CSC Data Processors Re-engineering Service aims at the implementation of a new Earth Observation Processor Framework (EOPF) and the re-engineering of the data processors currently used to operationally generate the Copernicus Sentinel-1/2/3(land) Level-0, Level-1, Level-2 data with the aim to harmonise and modernise the operational processing framework, to benefit from the capabilities of cloud-based environments such as the elasticity of computing resources and to efficiently support both the systematic production operations as well as the needs of a more flexible on-demand production context. CS GROUP has been selected by ESA as Prime Contractor for the Sentinels Data Processors Re-engineering Service. As part of this Service, CS GROUP will procure the implementation of the Sentinels processors re-engineering via open competitive tenders according to the ESA Best Practices procedure. The third open competitive tender covers the re-engineering of Sentinel-1 Level-1 and Level-2. <br> Doc Title: Research and development services and related consultancy services <br> Contract Type: Services. Published Date: 2023-05-20. Closing Date: 2024-05-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SAT PACA RAN. Summary: Production, Purification and Characterization of a Protein and its Variants. Description: the project will focus on the production, purification and characterization of a wild-type protein and its variants, mutated at the level of the protein sequence. This will initially involve the production and purification of these variants, followed by a thermal stability study and theforced graduation. This study will aim to assess how the variants change under given conditions (temperature, air humidity, light, pH, agitation, oxidizing agents) over a given period. The results will determine, among other things, the lifespan and the conditions ofrecommended storage. Finally, a functional study will make it possible to compare the binding to ligands and the efficiency of the different variants with respect to the wild-type protein<br> Doc Title: Design and execution of research and development<br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL COMPANY OF THE RHONE. Summary: Implementation Edna/Edna Framework Agreement. Description: As part of its commitments and actions to better understand, preserve and restore biodiversity, CNR has been carrying out or commissioning eDNA prospecting campaigns for 10 years. These innovative biotechnologies are increasingly used in the projects carried out by CNR and its subsidiaries.are. CNR thus wishes to engage in more marked collaborations for the implementation of eDNA methods. At this stage, the main use of eDNA is in aquatic environments (river, rivers, annexes), and in particular in large current river environments such as the Rhone. Settingimplementation of eDNA tools in other environments (soils, forests, meadows, air, etc.) are also considered. The taxonomic groups sought are often confined to aquatic environments (fish, bivalves, etc.) but total biodiversity can be the subject of research via eDNA (eukaryotes,mammiferes, flore, ...).<br> Doc Title: Environmental protection<br> Contract Type: Services. Published Date: 2023-04-08. Closing Date: 2023-04-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL COMPANY OF THE RHONE. Summary: Implementation Edna/Edna Framework Agreement. Description: As part of its commitments and actions to better understand, preserve and restore biodiversity, CNR has been carrying out or commissioning eDNA prospecting campaigns for 10 years. These innovative biotechnologies are increasingly used in the projects carried out by CNR and its subsidiaries.are. CNR thus wishes to engage in more marked collaborations for the implementation of eDNA methods. At this stage, the main use of eDNA is in aquatic environments (river, rivers, annexes), and in particular in large current river environments such as the Rhone. Settingimplementation of eDNA tools in other environments (soils, forests, meadows, air, etc.) are also considered. The taxonomic groups sought are often restricted to aquatic environments (fish, bivalves, etc.) but total biodiversity can be the subject of research via eDNA (eukaryotes,mammiferes, flore, ...).<br> Doc Title: Environmental protection<br> Contract Type: Services. Published Date: 2023-03-13. Closing Date: 2023-04-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Implementation Edna/Edna Framework Agreement

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RTE RÉSEAU DE TRANSPORT D'ELECTRICITÉ. Summary: Contract Framework for R&D Services. Description: This contract framework aims to cover a wide range of R&D needs in terms of studies and development in link with the different activities within the R&D department. The common denominator is the search for service providers capable of answering with a high level of expertise for each of the needs expressed. This framework is divided into 6 work packages: Work package 1: Optimization Work package 2: Supply-demand adequacy and electronics modelling Work package 3: Power system simulation & modeling Work package 4: Data management and analysis / Uncertainties (forecasting & contingencies) / Artificial intelligence & Machine learning Work package 5: Life cycle analysis Work package 6: Reliability and statistics for asset management Some of work packages might be divided into sub work packages. <br> Doc Title: Research and development services and related consultancy services <br> Contract Type: Services. Summary: Creation of a Guide on the Eco-Design of Port Infrastructures. Description: Title: Realization of a guide on the eco-design of port infrastructures<br> Subject: The main purpose of the service is the development of a guide with the aim of giving leads to port operators on the realization of developments integrated into the environment , while being ffunctionally effective. Practical and concrete recommendations are expected to encourage them to engage even more in a virtuous eco-design approach to limit pollution on the environment or even generate ecological benefits, save energy andraw materials, and reduce pressure on resources, the environment and greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions. This guide will have to propose pragmatic and realistic answers for the realization of works having a greater environmental performance throughout the cycle.of life, with, in particular: - a reduced residual impact on biodiversity; - a reduced carbon footprint (GHG emissions). This guide will present, through concrete examples, a state of the art of good practices that will allow everyone to better understand the eco-design of infrastructures.ports and their challenges, as well as operational recommendations.<br> Public entity: Ministry of Ecological Transition, Ministry of Territorial Cohesion, Ministry of the Sea<br> CPV code: 9071300073000000<br> Purchasing entity: MTES-MCTRCT-MER / AC / DGITM - General Direction.... output.Description: Title: Realization of a guide on the eco-design of port infrastructures<br> Subject: The main purpose of the service is the development of a guide with the aim of giving leads to port operators on the realization of developments integrated into the environment , while being ffunctionally effective. Practical and concrete recommendations are expected to encourage them to engage even more in a virtuous eco-design approach to limit pollution on the environment or even generate ecological benefits, save energy andraw materials, and reduce pressure on resources, the environment and greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions. This guide will have to propose pragmatic and realistic answers for the realization of works having a greater environmental performance throughout the cycle.of life, with, in particular: - a reduced residual impact on biodiversity; - a reduced carbon footprint (GHG emissions). This guide will present, through concrete examples, a state of the art of good practices that will allow everyone to better understand the eco-design of infrastructures.ports and their challenges, as well as operational recommendations.<br> Public entity: Ministry of Ecological Transition, Ministry of Territorial Cohesion, Ministry of the Sea<br> CPV code: 9071300073000000<br> Purchasing entity: MTES-MCTRCT-MER / AC / DGITM - General Direction...

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE FOR AGRICULTURE, FOOD AND THE ENVIRONMENT (75338 - PARIS CEDEX 07). Summary: Purchase of Targeted Meta Genomic Sequencing Services for Bacterial Food Ecosystems. Description: Title: Purchase of targeted Meta genomic sequencing services of food bacterial ecosystems<br> Subject: The purchase is made within the framework of the ANR-21-CE21-0008-01 (ESCAPE) project for which a high-performance sequencing service throughput was predicted. This project involves the determinationn the composition of microbial communities of meat products from chicken carcasses. For amplicon sequencing, the classical use of the 16S rDNA gene (v3-v4 region) is expected. Project partners will prepare DNA samples and analyze sequence datacage. Given the large number of samples planned, the desired depth of reading and the quality of the sequences necessary for the smooth running of the project, none of the project partners has the required sequencing capacity. The use of a sequencing service provider is thereforec required. This part of the project is located in the 2nd of the 4 experimental workpackages of the project and workpackages 3 and 4 depend on its success.<br> Public entity: Other organizations<br> CPV code: 73111000<br> Purchasing entity: AO / INRAE ​​/ Center PAYS DE LA LOIRE / INRAE ​​Unit 1014 SECALIM - SAFETY DES FOOD and MICROBIOLOGY<br> Ad type: Consultation ad<br> Main category: Services. Published Date: 2022-10-14. Closing Date: 2022-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

This project involves the determinationn the composition of microbial communities of meat products from chicken carcasses. For amplicon sequencing, the classical use of the 16S rDNA gene (v3-v4 region) is expected. Project partners will prepare DNA samples and analyze sequence datacage. Given the large number of samples planned, the desired depth of reading and the quality of the sequences necessary for the smooth running of the project, none of the project partners has the required sequencing capacity. The use of a sequencing service provider is thereforec required. This part of the project is located in the 2nd of the 4 experimental workpackages of the project and workpackages 3 and 4 depend on its success.<br> Public entity: Other organizations<br> CPV code: 73111000<br> Purchasing entity: AO / INRAE ​​/ Center PAYS DE LA LOIRE / INRAE ​​Unit 1014 SECALIM - SAFETY DES FOOD and MICROBIOLOGY<br> Ad type: Consultation ad<br> Main category: Services

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: STATE INTEREST AND GOVERNANCE AUTHORITY. Summary: Procurement of Consultancy Services for Development and Update of the Monitoring and Evaluation Framework. Description: Expression of Interest are invited for Procurement of Consultancy Services for Development and Update of the Monitoring and Evaluation Framework    The Consultant-s work consists mainly of four (4) parts, to: (i) review the existing M&E Systems of the Authority; (ii) review the existing performance evaluation framework; (iii) coordinate the preparation of the “draft evaluation report” for forty-Seven (47) Specified Entities (2017-2019); and (iv) provide recommendations for improvement of the existing M&E system, performance contracting and evaluation framework.  a) Review the existing M&E systems of the Authority to document and provide information on the processes, tools and systems used in the exercise of its functions. The review shall include the institutional arrangements and the methodologies used by the Authority and the tools to execute the functions.  b) Review the existing performance evaluation framework to document and provide information on the existing arrangement for evaluating the performance contract, to help determine the full scope of relevant issues that must be included in the individual Entities- report and the composite evaluation report. The review shall include a review of full evaluation report template and the abridged form to settle on the right format for the report.  c) Prepare the composite 2017 -2019 performance contract evaluation report. The consultant prepares the evaluation reports for the contracts signed in 2017 to 2019 to be submitted to the Specified Entities for review and approval. The reports shall be published by the Authority after engagement with the Specified Entities. In doing so, the Consultant is expected to prepare and submit checklist to the specified entities, review the responses, prepare the draft report, and submit to the entities for final review. The Consultant will provide update to the Management of SIGA on the progress of the report preparation in line with the reporting requirement.  d) Provide recommendations for improvement of the existing M&E system, performance contracting and evaluation framework. The Consultant shall be required to provide a report outlining the recommendations to be implemented by the Authority. The recommendations shall be classified in terms of institutional arrangement, methodology and capacity of the Authority to implement them. This shall further be categorised into short term, and long terms for implementation.    The State Interests and Governance Authority now invites eligible firms to express their interest by providing evidence of the following eligible documents for shortlisting.  a. Certificate to Commence Business  b. Certificate of Incorporation  c. VAT Registration Certificate  d. Valid Tax Clearance Certificate  e. Valid SNNIT Clearance Certificate  f. Valid Public Procurement Authority (PPA) Registration Certificate  g. Certified Audited Accounts for the past three (3) years (i.e., 2018, 2019 & 2020)  h. Firms Profile indicating relevant experience. Tender Value: 0. Published Date: 2021-11-18. Closing Date: 2021-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Agence Francaise De Development (AFD)

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SATT WEST VALORIZATION. Summary: Pharmacological Evaluation of a New Bioconjugue Radioemissive Chelating Agent Has a Therapeutic Antibody, in a Tumoral Model. Description: Property Description: The purpose of the present consultation is to select a provider who will be charged? To carry out the pharmacological evaluation and the proof of therapeutic concept of the P-NCS-BN-Chelate conjugate has a commercial antibody targeting a type of cancer or to its corresponding FAB fragment in the gastric cancers and / or the Colon expressing Her2. This benefit will include several phases with in particular: (i) a bioconjugation phase of the P-NCS-bn-chelate to the antibody and its radioarking in 64CU; (ii) a phase of in vitro study on different tumor lines, the performance of the complex compared to a complex involving a DOTA (P-NCS-BN-DOTA) (P-NCS-BN-DOA) channel; iii) a phase of the study of the biodistribution of the complex as a priority on a model of gastric cancer if the first steps have been conclusive on this model; iv) The last phase will be devoted to the study of anti-tumor efficiency as a priority on a model of gastric cancer if the previous stages have been conclusive on this model.. Published Date: 2021-11-01. Closing Date: 2021-12-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

This benefit will include several phases with in particular: (i) a bioconjugation phase of the P-NCS-bn-chelate to the antibody and its radioarking in 64CU; (ii) a phase of in vitro study on different tumor lines, the performance of the complex compared to a complex involving a DOTA (P-NCS-BN-DOTA) (P-NCS-BN-DOA) channel; iii) a phase of the study of the biodistribution of the complex as a priority on a model of gastric cancer if the first steps have been conclusive on this model; iv) The last phase will be devoted to the study of anti-tumor efficiency as a priority on a model of gastric cancer if the previous stages have been conclusive on this model.

The technological objective is intended to store the surplus photovoltaic energy produced outside the heating period to store it in the form of hydrogen and can reuse it via a fuel cell. <br> The objective of this demonstrator is to carry out an autonomous energy building in all seasons, to be able to reply and make it accessible on the market according to conditions and modalities that remain to be determined as part of an innovation partnership. ..
